key_points: Michelle Obama calls for the permanent ban of Donald Trump from social media platforms to prevent incitement of violence.
Donald Trump is currently blocked from posting to Facebook and Instagram 'indefinitely,' according to Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg.
Obama criticized Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube for not stopping extremist content from Trump and his supporters.
The call for banning Trump follows the recent rioting at the Capitol, which has been widely condemned.
Silicon Valley has been resistant to banning Trump, even amidst claims of voter fraud.
Anti-Defamation League CEO Jonathan Greenblatt blames Trump and tech companies for the Capitol violence, calling for a permanent ban.
Greenblatt emphasizes that freedom of expression does not include inciting violence.
Rep. Bennie G. Thompson calls for permanent bans on Trump's social media accounts.
Thompson criticizes Facebook and Twitter for only acting after significant violence occurred.
Sarah Kate Ellis of GLAAD urges Twitter CEO to ban Trump to protect people from further danger.
spokespersons: Rep. Bennie G. Thompson (D-MS, Chairman of the Committee on Homeland Security)
Sarah Kate Ellis (President and CEO, GLAAD)
